content:
Posted: December 22, 2016
												A game from my childhood, Operation Flashpoint: Cold War Crisis (as it was known back then) is THE ACTUAL FIRST ARMA (the original ARMA: Armed Assault is a spiritual successor to this game), and one of those games where you don't have any handholding. The game has two difficulties, Cadet and Veteran, or, as I like to call them, ♥♥♥♥ You and ♥♥♥♥ You Harder (Which you can tweak. God, old games are awesome). There is even an extra choice to make the AI even harder in the options menu, called Super AI, that you can apply to the other difficulties. I haven't tried it yet (since I'm still gitting gud) but I'm betting it turns the difficulties into You're So ♥♥♥♥ed, and Oh Look, You Just Got One Shot No Scoped By A Pistol From The Other Town 10km Over. Expect Dark Souls of shooters. If you aren't careful, you WILL be shot, and if you are shot, you are either dead, forced to crawl, or were extremely lucky and can take an extra shot. Overall, I really like the game, and the nostalgia factor that it has for me allows me to completely ignore it's visibly aging graphics and mechanics.

number of helpful: 0 of 9 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 15
												A leap into futuristic space combat hasn’t breathed a lot of new life into Call of Duty. With a scenic but poorly paced single-player campaign and multiplayer and zombies modes that succeed mostly by sticking close to what Black Ops 3 did last year, Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare is a generally fun but inessential shooter.2016 has been one of the best years for single-player shooter campaigns of the past decade. We’ve seen Doom, Titanfall 2, Gears of War 4, Battlefield 1, Deus Ex: Mankind Divided… and they're all better than Infinite Warfare’s campaign. It's not for want of something to differentiate it: this is a Call of Duty game where you fight in zero-G environments, and where you fly a spaceship called a Jackal and have a robot buddy called Ethan who is endearingly written. It should be awesome... but it’s mostly slow and plodding, and by the time the pace picks up there’s not enough game left to wash the disappointment of the first two-thirds out of your mouth

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Playtime at time of review:45 minutesDate at time of review:6/2/14First mission:Killed all of team unit before first rendezvous (getting out of helicopter), yet still heard characters talking at mission point. (Dead bodies surrounding me - I lol'd)Graphics/Video: [3/10]They are pretty impressive for being from 2001. Today, they are sub-par. But that's to be expected. Voice/Sound: [1/10]It was PROBABLY ok in 2001, but... It's not so great by todays standards, at all. I think this was the most unattractive part of the game for me.Game Mechanics: [5/10]The gameplay was pretty good, I really liked the aiming, and body mechanics (Except you could NOT sprint without a weapon in your hand? Confusing).Overall Score:[3/10]The game was ok, but the sound/voice acting killed it for me, nice game mechanics.Would recommend buying 75%-90% off if you're wanting to play this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 10 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												TL;DR Rating: 1/10I'm being completely honest when I say I couldn't even play this game. Despite the graphics looking like they where created on Windows 95, I decided that I should give this game a whirl since I got it on a free weekend. I launched it today for the first time, and used the fullscreen mode. I was using Steam Big Picture Mode to launch it, and it broke my gaming rig where it tried to draw windows over the screen and wouldn't accept cursor clicks in the game, but instead on my other windows. Thinking I hit a bug, I tried again in Windowed Mode. BIG MISTAKE. I tried this 3 times, as the cursor wouldn't sync, but instead have 1 cursor outside of the window, which sat upon the top left of my screen with no border to move it, and another cursor in game that was flying around like it was on a ton of sugar. I finally got full screen mode to work after numerus tries, and the cursor flew like I have never seen before. It was extreamly hard to get the the mouse sensitivity page like this, and when I finally did and set it lower, the cursor would lock in place constantly, only going on 1 axis (Mostly the x-axis). By this point I had reached my limit trying to play this crap. This isn't something that should be paid for, or even free. Honestly, I am disappointed that something like this would come out of a company such as this one. For anyone wondering, here are my specs just to be clear that it was not me:OS (Operating System): Windows 7 Ultimate EditionRAM (Random Access Memory): 6 GigabytesProcessor: Intel i7Mouse: Razor NagaKeyboard: Logitech EliteIn summery, I would not reccomend this game for anyone, and I think it would be better if it where completely removed from Steam altogether, as it's more trouble then it's worth. 1/10

content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												To put it frankly, this game is far too old and atiquated to enjoy. Being a 2001 game, you'd be surprised by how advanced this game makes Halo: CE seem and feel. As someone who is so used to playing games made within this decade, ARMA: Cold War Assault is a game that's graphics, mechanics, concept, and overall feel do nothing for me. I'm glad I got this game for free, because I would have absolutely regretted paying any amount of money for it. Perhaps if I played this game 13 years ago I could have enjoyed it, but with no sentimental value placed on this title, there is no reason for a gamer like me to play this game.

number of helpful: 4 of 19 people (21%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												I happened to get this for free during Bohemia Interactive's anniversary so I got a little curious to try it out. Basically what I'm going to say is that this will be based on my first impressions on this title and to me being exposed to the ARMA franchise in general. After playing the campaign mode for a few hours, I got bored and had more fun team killing my own AI squad members than actually playing the game simply because of how restrictive I felt performing these missions and add the fact that I was walking around 90% of the time with nothing to shoot at. I'm pretty sure you can run off from your squad and do something else, but even if that was possible, the level still feels barren with very little encounters. Of course, what else am I expecting off of this, it's a modern military shooter so of course the entire point of the game is to do objectives while trying to avoid firefights as much as possible. Story-wise, it's not very interesting with the game being set in during the Cold War with the main objective is, you guessed it, kill the Russians, simple as that. The controls at first feels very awkward, but that can always be fixed by rebinding your keys to something you would feel comfortable playing with. Personally the other modes like multiplayer and custom missions are more fun to play because you obviously have more freedom for you to play around. If I were to come back to this, I would just play around with the custom missions, but thats about it. I simply cannot recommend this game just for my own disliking of modern military shooters, but if you are a hardcore ARMA fan, then go right ahead and buy this. It has everything you would expect from an ARMA game.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												This game is a great example of how the future versions of Arma are so successful. By taking the flaws from Arma: Cold War Assault, future games like Arma 2 and Arma 3 improve upon its past mistakes and push out a product that is enjoyable to the players. Would I recommend this? No, but Bohemia Interactive has expanded and provided massive improvements in its other games. For an enjoyable and modern experience, I suggest looking at Arma 2 and Arma 3.Rating: 0.2/10 (2%)No Achievements.Game Done.

number of helpful: 3 of 17 people (18%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 22, 2014
												I bought this game because i'm a 48 year old unemployed war simulation veteran and to be frank this game is far from what I define "Realistic" for starters there is no bullet drop and precipitation, the models are very low quality so I cant even mod in my online avatar that I call "John "Cannonball" Billy" a 23 year old strapping lad who had recently joined the army and then he got shot in the eye with a big gun that goes pow pow.Me and my pals in our leisure time like to go to the local park and reenact some old war scenes like the DDAY landings but in this case we use the swingsets as machine gun nests and when you are hit with the nerf dart you have to act like you're dead otherwise you would be instantly expelled from the war roleplay/larping club.Arma ruins my war immersion as soon as I launch the game, MAIN MENUS IN REAL LIFE? I DONT THINK SO!!!! OPTIONS MENUS IN REAL LIFE???? NOPE! I want to be put straight into the action so I can actually stay immersed and not lose my war induced boner.3/10 - Call of Duty is way better at simulation.

number of helpful: 6 of 24 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												In the 7 minutes I played this, I wanted to cry, throw up, and spit on the computer screen all at once. First came nausia at the main menu's mouse movement, and I've never had that happen for any game, then came the sorrow, thinking, "I actually bought this?" when going into game and getting the ♥♥♥♥ed up movements, then I realized that I got it for free, and then came the sarcastic "I feel sorry for you," sympathetic type thing for the fact that this game was free and still terrible, then came the confusion at the fact that there are so many positive reveiews and the GOTY awards and such, then the anger at the many mixed emotions I was having. I have nothing against the graphics, the terrible story and setup, and even the controls could be useful if there was the option to turn off the mouse-like crosshair like in 007 Goldeneye and Time Splitters 2, but to leave me to deal with that in a huge fire fight? Normally I'd laugh at games like this, but since I know that this game has the makings of a good game, it still sucks and is too outdated to hope for updates. Yeah, I dont regret getting it considering it was free, but I do regret ever hoping "Hey, this is a good deal for a game in an AWESOME series like ARMA," Just promise me you won't use your 5.00$ on this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and get something like Oddworld, K?

content:
Posted: May 19, 2014
												Arma Cold War is a solid game and a respected predecessor to the newer Arma titles, yet this game really shows its age. The graphics are very polygon-heavy, the levels are often too open and undetailed, the difficulty is too easy, and the simplicity of the gameplay strips the meat off the metaphorical bones (You only have a M16 for most of the campaign and you can't drive any vehicles unless it's required for the mission at hand) But I digress...I personally rate Arma Cold War a B- . It's not a bad game, especially for one that Bohemia gave us for free during the 15th Anniversary Sale, but comparred to it's successors it feels like one big demo. For a true-blue military simulator experience, buy Arma 2 instead, and if your system is REALLY beefed up, punch it up a notch with Arma 3.

												ARMA: Cold War Assult is a game that at one time was pretty cool. But because of it's lack of multiplayer servers and outdated graphics, it seems impractical to purchase this specific game. I recomend you try the original ARMA or ARMA II. Don't get me wrong, it's not a bad game. But it just doesn't bring anything new or worthwhile to the table except for the Cold War theme. If you're in to pre-made scenarios and mediocre single player military simulations, go for it. But like I said, I would go for one of the newer games, or at least one that is multiplayer.

This game also lacks any sort of tutorial which normally, would not be a problem is the mouse intergation on the menus wasn't so bad.I stongly suggest never touching this even though at the current moment of writing this it is free, it would be a massive waste of data.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2016
												Call of Duty is a 2003 first-person shooter video game developed by Infinity Ward and published by Activision. It is the first of many installments in the Call of Duty franchise. The game simulates infantry and combined arms warfare of World War II using a modified version of the id Tech 3 engine built for Quake III: Team Arena. Much of its theme and gameplay is similar to the Medal of Honor series; however, Call of Duty showcases multiple viewpoints staged in the British, American, and Soviet theaters of World War II.The game introduced a new take on AI-controlled allies who support the player during missions and react to situational changes during gameplay. This led to a greater emphasis on squad-based play as opposed to the "lone wolf" approach often portrayed in earlier first-person shooter games. Much of Infinity Ward's development team consisted of members who helped develop Medal of Honor: Allied Assault.In September 2004, an expansion pack called Call of Duty: United Offensive, which was produced by Activision and developed by Gray Matter Interactive and Pi Studios, was released. On November 10, 2009, the "Hardened" and "Prestige" editions of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 debuted, including redemption codes for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 versions under the title, Call of Duty Classic.

number of helpful: 2 of 16 people (13%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												My first venture into the "Arma" series and not looking good unfortunately, I applaud the game for being so vast for it's publish date but it seems as if they tried to do WAY too much with it for technical limitations. We all love intricate games that let you control various things, but it is more time spent looking for the right button and trying to figure out how to perform the simplest of tasks that are compounded by going through 4 different mini-menus on the screen.  I really don't care about graphics, but the game plays smooth, I will give it that.As for the single player, I'm stuck following a yellow square for the objective, but it feels as if the game drags me around on a leash instead of the clear plan they present at the beginning of the mission. For one that is go south, then go north-west... it turns into go south, then make 50 course-corrections only to be told to turn around and follow the leader and wherever he decides to turn while still fumbling at controls to tell each person what direction to properly stand it seems.I really was hoping for a great experience as I hear so much hype about Arma, but this just seems like a game where they tried to cram too many interaction controls into too many menus, for concept I give it an 8/10.... but overall layout and execution sorry but it's dropped way down to a 2/10.

number of helpful: 1 of 14 people (7%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												Should have posted after I finished the game. Instead of doing a review in progress.Early stage of the game, lots of pointless moving from point A to B. Can't tell friend from foe and can't see where the enemy is, especially near night time, but somehow your AI can tell where they are and their AI can tell where you are. Daytime, I actually seeing and killing the enemy, but my squad is still able to kill them before I see them or they get themselves wipeout and I just run to an objective point. To elaborate why I consider how the missions are setup to be a waste of time. One mission defend installation. Could be a glitch but only one enemy showed up. Waste of time. Some mission in one form or another. Go from point A to point B. Die at point B. Waste time moving to point B again. Die. Repeat a few times before decide to use up my only save slightly before point B. Skirmish from point B to C. Waste time moving to point D. Seems like people equate repeating the same tedious moventment as the price of failure somehow makes this a good game. Half way through the campaign you get to choose your gear and control your squad. If I had the sniper rifle at the beginning of the game, i'm pretty sure i could of Ramboed my way across the map. Really the AI isn't that good, the only thing is you have to kill them before they notice your presence since they are very accurate once they know you're there. Otherwise they are very clueless. Either I could be prone in plain sight about 50m away and they don't react or I kill a bunch of their comrades but they don't seem to notice. Really only 2 or 3 missions were hard fun. A good chunk were just tedious. Since some of the positive reviews haven't put much game time in recently, I'm thinking nostalgia is factoring into their opinion, though I can see why it was GOTY in 2001. Of course, the graphics sucks but it's a 2001 game not a 2011 game. Wish steam would put when the game was originally released not digitally released. Playing on a xp computer game works fine.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2013
												Operation Flashpoint (I'm not calling it ArmA, it's Operation Flashpoint) is one of the best military games ever and this one, the very first one, is my personal favorite because it has the best campaign and atmosphere (nothing can beat the Cold War)However, all of that excitement and excellent gameplay goes out the window the minute you start the missions, because 80% of the time the scripts controlling the missions DO NOT WORK CORRECTLYExample: I failed the tutorial just because I completed it too fast2nd example: I spent at least 1 hour on a Rescue mission that takes 5 minutes tops, because the Friendly AI would not move faster even though I clearly secured the village, and they would NOT ♥♥♥♥ING DRIVE THE TRUCK BECAUSE THE COMMANDER KEPT TELLING TWO SOLDIERS TO DISEMBARK EVEN THOUGH THEY SHOULD BE IN THE VEHICLE AND BY THE TIME THEY DID GET OUT AND GOT BACK IN, A ♥♥♥♥ING TANK COMES IN AND KILLS US ALLI'm sorry, this franchise is fun and I love it but I can never enjoy it most of the time due to the broken mission scripts that plague every single game (OFP, ArmA: Armed Assault, ArmA2 + OA) and if ArmA3 continues this game breaking issue, it will be a huge disappointment

Posted: June 6, 2016
												If there was a Dark Souls for military shooter sims, you're looking at the comment review section for it. Her unforgivable shooting mechanics, brutally low player hp and sneaky AI makes for a frustrating playthrough. It's just that with the low price of Arma 2, and the success of Arma 3 you'll realize that the game is not in its best form here. Multiplayer is non-existent, graphics are putrid, and the weapon diversity or action options can get pretty stale. If you're desperately looking for a free game title, this might be worth the pain and agony. Do not pay for this. Battlefield 2 would be a better cure for your old school FPS nostalgia.

content:
Posted: April 3
I am reviewing this game to modern standards. While not exactly fair to the game, I am showing why I find it a bad purchase.This game is amazing considering it was made in 2001, but it certainly does NOT hold up to modern day standards (which is no suprise). It is clunky, has fairly bad controls (but can be rebinded), and on top of that the graphics are flat out ugly.However what I do love about it is that there is so much variety compaired to ARMA 3. But sadly this does not make up for the clunky, outdated gameplay.Purchase if your looking for a "novelty" or nostalgic type of game, but I can't say you should buy it if your looking to actually play the game. If you are purchasing a realisitc/ARMA game, I'd suggest the upgraded (but still buggy) ARMA 3, or the cheaper alternative (but with more content), ARMA 2. A2 has a lot of quality DLCs too, would be a good deal to get it on sale with all the DLC.But do know that the review of the reviews are very biased on this game, and I'm not saying that because I'm getting bad reviews. If you look at the all time negative reviews you will see all are majorly downvoted.

content:
Posted: April 9
												According to all known lawsof aviation, there is no way a beeshould be able to fly. Its wings are too small to getits fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway because bees don't carewhat humans think is impossible. Yellow, black. Yellow, black.Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Ooh, black and yellow!Let's shake it up a little. Barry! Breakfast is ready! Ooming! Hang on a second. Hello? - Barry?- Adam? - Oan you believe this is happening?- I can't. I'll pick you up. Looking sharp. Use the stairs. Your fatherpaid good money for those. Sorry. I'm excited. Here's the graduate.We're very proud of you, son. A perfect report card, all B's. Very proud. Ma! I got a thing going here. - You got lint on your fuzz.- Ow! That's me! - Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.- Bye! Barry, I told you,stop flying in the house! - Hey, Adam.- Hey, Barry. - Is that fuzz gel?- A little. Special day, graduation. Never thought I'd make it. Three days grade school,three days high school. Those were awkward. Three days college. I'm glad I tooka day and hitchhiked around the hive. You did come back different. - Hi, Barry.- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. - Hear about Frankie?- Yeah. - You going to the funeral?- No, I'm not going. Everybody knows,sting someone, you die. Don't waste it on a squirrel.Such a hothead. I guess he could havejust gotten out of the way. I love this incorporatingan amusement park into our day. That's why we don't need vacations. Boy, quite a bit of pomp...under the circumstances. - Well, Adam, today we are men.- We are! - Bee-men.- Amen! Hallelujah! Students, faculty, distinguished bees, please welcome Dean Buzzwell. Welcome, New Hive Oitygraduating class of... ...9:15. That concludes our ceremonies. And begins your careerat Honex Industries! Will we pick ourjob today? I heard it's just orientation. Heads up! Here we go. Keep your hands and antennasinside the tram at all times. - Wonder what it'll be like?- A little scary. Welcome to Honex,a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you, as a bee,have worked your whole life to get to the point where youcan work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant PollenJocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top-secret formula is automatically color-corrected,scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctivegolden glow you know as... Honey! - That girl was hot.- She's my cousin! - She is?- Yes, we're all cousins. - Right. You're right.- At Honex, we constantly strive to improve every aspectof bee existence. These bees are stress-testinga new helmet technology. - What do you think he makes?- Not enough. Here we have our latest advancement,the Krelman. - What does that do?- Oatches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it.Saves us millions. Oan anyone work on the Krelman? Of course. Most bee jobs aresmall ones. But bees know that every small job,if it's done well, means a lot. But choose carefully because you'll stay in the jobyou pick for the rest of your life. The same job the rest of your life?I didn't know that. What's the difference? You'll be happy to know that bees,as a species, haven't had one day off in 27 million years. So you'll just work us to death? We'll sure try. Wow! That blew my mind! "What's the difference?"How can you say that? One job forever?That's an insane choice to have to make. I'm relieved. Now we only haveto make one decision in life. But, Adam, how could theynever have told us that? Why would you question anything?We're bees. We're the most perfectlyfunctioning society on Earth. You ever think maybe thingswork a little too well here? Like what? Give me one example. I don't know. But you knowwhat I'm talking about. Please clear the gate.Royal Nectar Force on approach. Wait a second. Oheck it out. - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!- Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's likeoutside the hive. Yeah, but some don't come back. - Hey, Jocks!- Hi, Jocks! You guys did great! You're monsters!You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it! - I wonder where they were.- I don't know. Their day's not planned. Outside the hive, flying who knowswhere, doing who knows what. You can'tjust decide to be a PollenJock. You have to be bred for that. Right. Look. That's more pollenthan you and I will see in a lifetime. It's just a status symbol.Bees make too much of it. Perhaps. Unless you're wearing itand the ladies see you wearing it. Those ladies?Aren't they our cousins too? Distant. Distant. Look at these two. - Oouple of Hive Harrys.- Let's have fun with them. It must be dangerousbeing a Pollen Jock. Yeah. Once a bear pinned meagainst a mushroom! He had a paw on my throat,and with the other, he was slapping me! - Oh, my!- I never thought I'd knock him out. What were you doing during this? Trying to alert the authorities. I can autograph that. A little gusty out there today,wasn't it, comrades? Yeah. Gusty. We're hitting a sunflower patchsix miles from here tomorrow. - Six miles, huh?- Barry! A puddle jump for us,but maybe you're not up for it. - Maybe I am.- You are not! We're going 0900 at J-Gate. What do you think, buzzy-boy?Are you bee enough? I might be. It all dependson what 0900 means. Hey, Honex! Dad, you surprised me. You decide what you're interested in? - Well, there's a lot of choices.- But you only get one. Do you ever get boreddoing the same job every day? Son, let me tell you about stirring. You grab that stick, and you justmove it around, and you stir it around. You get yourself into a rhythm.It's a beautiful thing. You know, Dad,the more I think about it, maybe the honey fieldjust isn't right for me. You were thinking of what,making balloon animals? That's a bad jobfor a guy with a stinger. Janet, your son's not surehe wants to go into honey! - Barry, you are so funny sometimes.- I'm not trying to be funny. You're not funny! You're goinginto honey. Our son, the stirrer! - You're gonna be a stirrer?- No one's listening to me! Wait till you see the sticks I have. I could say anything right now.I'm gonna get an ant tattoo! Let's open some honey and celebrate! Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.Shave my antennae. Shack up with a grasshopper. Geta gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"! I'm so proud. - We're starting work today!- Today's the day. Oome on! All the good jobswill be gone. Yeah, right. Pollen counting, stunt bee, pouring,stirrer, front desk, hair removal... - Is it still available?- Hang on. Two left! One of them's yours! Oongratulations!Step to the side. - What'd you get?- Picking crud out. Stellar! Wow! Oouple of newbies? Yes, sir! Our first day! We are ready! Make your choice. - You want to go first?- No, you go. Oh, my. What's available? Restroom attendant's open,not for the reason you think. - Any chance of getting the Krelman?- Sure, you're on.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
												Don't let the somewhat quirky graphics fool you. This game is a masterpiece. Released over a decade ago and yet still in my opinion, the greatest game ever made. I can't tell you how many thousands upon thousands of hours I spent in the editor making my own missions and battles. Your heart will actually beat faster when sneaking up on a base full of "reds" in the aim of blowing up their parked tanks. You will have to take your time and be tactical in your decision making. This is no "run and gun" arcade shooter. This is "I have to position my AT soldier on that hill, so he can hit that tank in hope of disabling it whilst we open fire at exactly the right time on the sentries patrolling the surrounding cluster of houses. If we don't kill them all in time they will spot and maybe take out our injured and exposed fire team who has painstakingly crept into position just behind that grouping of bushes". It is an amazing experience and still market it to friends as superior to any of the unfinished pre-alpha crap that game makers release today.

												I mostly enjoyed my time with the game. For it's age the gameplay is really solid and the realistic nature makes it one of the most immersive war games I have played. Posted: May 17, 2014
												i remember playng this when i was 7 - i was addicted to it. this game was literally my childhood. every day id hope my dad came home from his IT college course with some form of addon, as he did occassionally. this game has plenty of mods for you to choose from, ranging from full conversion mods to small little addons such as just a simple vehicle or gun. the singleplayer campaign is great because of how diverse it is. the game is truely open world, you can go where ever you want in what ever mission. the mission editor is your chance to create your own mission to share with the world, or just to have a bit of fun. this is the mode i played the most, and you can do everything in it. the multiplayer in the game works the same as the multiplayer in arma 2.all in all, this game is a must and im so glad that it is free now, because the original discs i have are.. "aged"this also includes the "gold upgrade" pack, and the "resistance" expansion, filefront is also a very good site for getting mods and addons for this game

content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												This game is one of my favorite games of all time.  Alot of people may hate on this game saying "These graphics are♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; or "It's too hard" and such, but the graphics don't matter at all, I mean for Christ sake, it was made in 2001!  I still play alot of older games especially PS2 games, which had some really good games, but compared to now the graphics are♥♥♥♥♥♥ WHO THE ♥♥♥♥ CARES?!?!?!  Arma Cold War Assault is a realistic war simulator.  You are put into a scenario, in which you choose how you are to finish.  You can go stealthily through on some levels, or come in guns a blazin'.  While the aim may be a bit weird at first, you'll get used to it and see that if that it's actually in some cases better than just a crossheir stuck in the middle of the screen.  This game also happens to be as hard as my♥♥♥♥♥♥ and can get frustrating at times, but the challenge is fun (At least in my opinion).  Side note: I am not a hardcore Arma fan or anything, I just got into the Arma series like 6 months ago, and saw this one over the weekend was free, so I downloaded it.  Even though this is the oldest of the Armas, this one is probably my favorite.  As long as you can get past the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ N64 like graphics, DEFINETLY download this.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												This is still definitely the defining battlefield simulator game even after so many years. Despite the release of later sequels such as ArmA 1, 2 and 3, it still cannot replicate that realistic feel as well as this one. For some reason, I kind of like the radio communication system which sounds more natural rather than more robotic like of ArmA 1 and 2.I remember playing the excellent campaign when I was just 13, and man, I was real terrified when I played the mission where you are all alone in the forest without any friends, with the enemy combing for you. That's how good and realistic it is. If that's not enough, plenty of user made addons to play with. Need I say more?THIS IS 1 TAKING COMMAND, I SAY AGAIN, 1 TAKING COMMAND!5, ENGAGE BMP!OH NO, 5 IS DOWN!BMP IS HISTORY!:)

content:
Posted: May 19, 2014
												I still remember the late afternoon back in late 2001 when I played this for the first time. I'd recommend this to anyone that likes realistic shooters and anybody else that has the patience to die a whole lot. This is one of the first complete war simulation games that still is a whole hell of a lot of fun. Yes, the game is very hard. No, it's not the prettiest in the world. Yes, there are some problems with both enemy and friendly AI. Yes, there are little control issues. But none of these things are enough to keep me from raving about it 13 years after release. Instant classic

content:
Posted: May 19, 2014
												It's an old game, so it isn't fair to compare it to anything new really... But its actually really fun. Store says singleplayer but there is actually a ton of co-op if you use tunngle. Realistic bullet damage means you don't empty an entire mag into someone to kill them. However, you die just as easily. A lot of tactical potential. Seems to discourage the "run-and-gun" of most modern FPS games. One complaint I had was the controls. Once you rebind them, they're great, but they start off terrible. Overall I recommend it. (Current price should also be taken into account. Worth no more than $10.)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												The thing that really blew me away about Operation Flashpoint was the deadly realism. The game came out when Quake was popular and other makers of shooters tried to copy its manic play style. But, Operation Flashpoint was different. If you run down the main road of a town, you will get shot and you will die. I swear, I spent half the game crawling on my belly, since I knew peeking my head up over the grass could mean instant death. Playing the game again, I was impressed by how it was still fun the play. Sure, the graphics are dated, but it didn't matter after a while. Modern Warfare immerses you in the setting with beautiful graphics, but breaks the illusion with magical "healing behind cover". Cold War Assault doesn't catch you at first, but the stunning realism makes you feel more like you're actually there than pretty graphics. Modern Warfare fans will have to adjust to a more realistic way of playing...and I think you'll like it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												I played this obsessively as a youngster (10-11ish) with fond memories of "Oh no! 1 is down! This is 2 taking command, I repeat 2 taking command!" or "RIGHT! FORWARD! RIGHT! FORWARD!" Back then it was called Operation Flashpoint:Cold War Crisis with the tagline "When you see the flash, it's already too late!" so to see it offered free under ArmA:Cold War Assault I immediately clicked install.I wasn't very good at it being a kid and all most missions were 1 or 2 stars with few kills and lots of allied deaths and I  just liked shooting and the feeling but now i'm older and know military tactics. This game is astounding and nostalgia and memory just poured out of my head when i loaded this up again. I don't think BI have crafted a story or atmosphere like this since. I'm utterly kicking♥♥♥♥♥right now getting regular 4 or 5 stars on each mission. I just completed Saboteur(mission 23 of 42)with 12k points and lots of well timed kills in around 22 mins of adrenaline,patience and stealth with just 4 satchel charges(plus 2 off a dead spetsnatz),NVG and 2 clips of MP5 ammo. My heart was pounding as much as the infamous "After Montignac" level. I also have Resistance and Red Hammer to play as I never got a chance to play those campaigns for OFP when I was younger. For fans of the first cold war era(Imagine future military sims of todays blossoming cold war!)where the threat of nuclear war was imminent 24/7 this is a must. I wouldn't recommend this to the majority of the COD generation who are too used to very easy game mechanics which require no thought what so ever as it would go over their head unless you're willing to give a game that was once way ahead of its time a chance then I promise...you will love the detail,story,tactics and atmosphere.It's been many years CWC but I'm back and I still love you. "This is 2 taking command, I repeat 2 taking command... over."4.5/5P.S proud to say so far I haven't lost a single squadmate under my command.But it's early days yet, The invasion of Everon is about to commence and I have memories of it being brutal or was that Kolgujev...

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												When you first start up the game, you think it is complete trash. The controls are wonky, the graphics were great 12 years ago but they could have updated them slightly before they released the game in 2011. The AI can be way too smart at some times but that is easy to get over. If you have any friends, this game will be a blast on multiplayer, if you can get into a full lobby. The Singleplayer can also be fun on multiplayer if you guys are racing to beat the level. The single missions are very rewarding when completed. I give Arma: Cold war assault an 8/10 recommended to people that dont mind bad graphics animations voice acting or cutscenes.

												Operation Flashpoint...How many positive feelings this mean to me... How many hours were spent... It was one of the best tactical simulators in 2001. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 19, 2016
												Back in 2001, there was nothing like the original Operation Flashpoint: Cold War Crisis (the former name of this game). This game was nothing short of legendary, and it provided an unrivalled singleplayer experience which was only limited by the imagination of mission makers. The multiplayer was also memorable, but only if you happened to join a dedicated team playing good missions.The game has aged badly graphics wise and the engine does not scale well with modern systems. The game also needs a 3rd party aspect ratio fix, which can be found here: http://ofp-faguss.com/ofp_aspect_ratioIf you can accept these issues, the original campaigns are still fun to play, and the internet is full of custom mods and missions. =)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
												Not what you'd expect based on other ARMA games, but a decent military sim anyway. Seems more difficult than the sequel since you die more easily, trees block your vision but not bot vision, and there are fewer animated ways to get over/around things.EDIT: I can't recommend this particular version due to the complete and total lack of multiplayer. Oh well.EDIT 2: Somewhere along the line, the game finally got multiplayer! Better yet, the game works decently under PlayOnLinux (you can join games, but you can't host due to most Linux distros preferring to keep their ports closed; Port 2302 is the port to unblock).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 28
												An undying classic from my childhood. It is clunky, rough, has weird controls and a steep learning curve, and as a new player, you can expect to be killed over and over again by unseen enemies hiding in bushes 300 metres away. It is the dark souls of military games. Yet, if you overcome this frustration and learn the enemy's behaviour, you will be rewarded with it's deep strategic gameplay, non-linear mission design and strong atmosphere.

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
												Despite the early-2000s graphics, this game is an excellent purchase.  As the game that started it all, it can be expected to deliver much enjoyment and many hours of fun.  By today's standards, the game is poor in quality, but the visual and audible shortcomings are but an insect in the path of the oncoming tank that is the gameplay experience itself.  Nothing feels more satisfying than mowing down Russians in a stolen MI-24 HIND that is still sitting on the tarmac, or crawling for miles to search for a medic to heal my broken leg, only to discover that the medic was killed in a firefight with a Russian patrol (which, by the way, is hunting for YOU now).  It is not hard to see why this game not only sparked the fire, but also fanned the flame to build the community and following that the whole ArmA series has now.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 9, 2015
												OK LISTEN UP YOU MAGGOTS!!!! <---- Imitation of a drill sergeantThe release date here on steam does indeed say August 8, 2011 BUT, and its a big but,  it was NOT first released in 2011.The game was first released to the public in 2006.  This game is a remade Operation Flashpoint Cold War Crisis (2001), updated graphics engine, scripting abilities, physics, new units and vehicles, but Bohemia broke ties with Codemasters before 2006 and since Codemasters has legal rights to the name Operation Flashpoint Bohemia Interactive had to choose another.From having played Operation Flashpoint: Dragon Rising, Codemaster developed and published, it was much more acadey then the previous OFP game and I assume Codemasters wanted a faster pace and easier game to publish to appeal to a wider audience and hence make more money.  Nothing really wrong with that but i do prefer Bohemia Interactives vision more even though I die, ALOT, usually (At times it seems it's a toss up between Dark Souls Prepare to Die edition and Arma series how often I end up dieing(ok trying to be funny as I am not really THAT bad of a player).  The successes make it worthwhile.  Oh some of the mods for the different ArmA make it extremely fun, easier or more difficult if that is your thing.

												This is still definitely the defining battlefield simulator game even after so many years. Despite the release of later sequels such as ArmA 1, 2 and 3, it still cannot replicate that realistic feel as well as this one. That's how good and realistic it is. If that's not enough, plenty of user made addons to play with. 												It's an old game, so it isn't fair to compare it to anything new really... But its actually really fun. Store says singleplayer but there is actually a ton of co-op if you use tunngle. Realistic bullet damage means you don't empty an entire mag into someone to kill them. However, you die just as easily. A lot of tactical potential. Seems to discourage the "run-and-gun" of most modern FPS games. One complaint I had was the controls. Once you rebind them, they're great, but they start off terrible. Overall I recommend it. (Current price should also be taken into account. Worth no more than $10.)

												Okay so I was doing this sniper mission where I had to shoot an officer or something in this convoy. So when I saw him I took the shot and I got him!!! But then (as in real life) all the enemies knew exactly where I was and they started shooting. So my guy was running to the extraction point and the tank (which was like on the horizon) fired and killed me. So real. So lifelike. I wondered why I forgot about this game. And I pondered for a very long time how precise the Russian tank was. But then I realized Soviet Bear was probably piloting the tank. And Soviet Bear hates the West with extreme prejudice. So I finally figured out how I died lol.10/10 (with such realism and graphics you cant put it down)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 24, 2014
												One of the best war simulations out there. Even though it's an old game, and graphics are old, but gameplay is realistic and really amazing. I've played this game when it came out originaly called Operation Flashpoint, and this game still kicks♥♥♥♥♥ AI is pretty much skilled and they kill very easily, one shot = one kill...- 2 Campaigns with awesome story (Resistance and American), but too bad there's not russian campaign called Red Hammer, which was also quiet amazing.- USA campaign tells the story of an Soldier, Tank crew, Pilot and Special Op guy, through 30 missions you will basicaly learn everything, from how to shoot and and survive to driving tank, airplane, choppers, etc.- Resistance campaign is also very amazing, because you need to get as many stuff (weapons, NV Goggles, ammo) as you can and take care of your people, because it transfers from one mission to another...- You can drive almost every vehicle in this game, from planes to motorcycles,- lead your own team of people, and order them what to do and where to go- Awesome mission editor where you can make your own missions and campaigns.It's really worth of the money, really cheap for a really good game

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 9, 2011
												OPERATION FLASHPOINT.The game that was the most realistic military combat simulator, "back in the day".Played it from a DEMO disc running on my first computer and I fell in love.Beware, your squadmates are your best friend and radio chatter your conscience.Nothing goes as expected and there are multiple ways a mission can play out.Be cautious as you tread behind enemy lines and ruthless when on a full out assault.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												This game is amazing. There are many problems but all in all it's so worth it. The engine and controls are clunky, the graphics are attrocious (understandably) but it doesn't matter because once you get into it it's so immersive.So to keep this from dragging on, the gameplay is awesome, it's realistic (as far as a game of this age can go) so one too many shots and you're dead. If you get into an engagment and take hits it's pretty much over, you really need to be the one with the better position or be the one who fires first. This makes tactics extremely important for example positioning yourself, knowing when the move when to stay put, when to fire and when to hold. It could all mean the difference between them getting a few shots off and that'll spell you're end.And the missions are extremely varied, the story is naf but the missions range from 1-3 men late at night blowing up an entire base (stealth and tactical). Mass infantry+armor operations to attack towns and villages. Helicopter transport/attack etc missions. Tank crew missions (which are awesome fun but take time to get good at) and even more than this. It's seriously awesome. So i would no doubt recommend this game, it's incredible and I still have fun playing it this long after it was made. The one draw back i should point out is the checkpoint system as you can only save once per mission which means you take 10 minutes longer to do anything which some poeple (including myself) like. However if you dispise this feature and wish to be a little more reckless i will give you this hint/cheat for reading all the way to the end. Go onto the pause menu at any point in a mission and click "shift" and "-" at the same time then type "savegame". You're welcome. :)

content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												i remember playng this when i was 7 - i was addicted to it. this game was literally my childhood. every day id hope my dad came home from his IT college course with some form of addon, as he did occassionally. this game has plenty of mods for you to choose from, ranging from full conversion mods to small little addons such as just a simple vehicle or gun. the singleplayer campaign is great because of how diverse it is. the game is truely open world, you can go where ever you want in what ever mission. the mission editor is your chance to create your own mission to share with the world, or just to have a bit of fun. this is the mode i played the most, and you can do everything in it. the multiplayer in the game works the same as the multiplayer in arma 2.all in all, this game is a must and im so glad that it is free now, because the original discs i have are.. "aged"this also includes the "gold upgrade" pack, and the "resistance" expansion, filefront is also a very good site for getting mods and addons for this game

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												This game is one of my favorite games of all time.  Alot of people may hate on this game saying "These graphics are♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; or "It's too hard" and such, but the graphics don't matter at all, I mean for Christ sake, it was made in 2001!  I still play alot of older games especially PS2 games, which had some really good games, but compared to now the graphics are♥♥♥♥♥♥ WHO THE ♥♥♥♥ CARES?!?!?!  Arma Cold War Assault is a realistic war simulator.  You are put into a scenario, in which you choose how you are to finish.  You can go stealthily through on some levels, or come in guns a blazin'.  While the aim may be a bit weird at first, you'll get used to it and see that if that it's actually in some cases better than just a crossheir stuck in the middle of the screen.  This game also happens to be as hard as my♥♥♥♥♥♥ and can get frustrating at times, but the challenge is fun (At least in my opinion).  Side note: I am not a hardcore Arma fan or anything, I just got into the Arma series like 6 months ago, and saw this one over the weekend was free, so I downloaded it.  Even though this is the oldest of the Armas, this one is probably my favorite.  As long as you can get past the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ N64 like graphics, DEFINETLY download this.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												i remember playng this when i was 7 - i was addicted to it. this game was literally my childhood. every day id hope my dad came home from his IT college course with some form of addon, as he did occassionally. this game has plenty of mods for you to choose from, ranging from full conversion mods to small little addons such as just a simple vehicle or gun. the singleplayer campaign is great because of how diverse it is. the game is truely open world, you can go where ever you want in what ever mission. the mission editor is your chance to create your own mission to share with the world, or just to have a bit of fun. this is the mode i played the most, and you can do everything in it. the multiplayer in the game works the same as the multiplayer in arma 2.all in all, this game is a must and im so glad that it is free now, because the original discs i have are.. "aged"this also includes the "gold upgrade" pack, and the "resistance" expansion, filefront is also a very good site for getting mods and addons for this game

												Don't let the ARMA label fool you; this is where it all started, my friends. Yes, it's Operation Flashpoint: Cold War Crisis. One of the first (if not THE first) FPS games to incorporate warfare on a massive scale with combined arms, now "updated" with a patch for play on modern systems running Windows XP and 7. If like me you have fond memories of this tactical sim, do purchase and find yourself awashed in nostalgic gaming goodness.
